channel.title: a Proxy between Whonix-Workstation and Whonix-Gateway (Whonix-Workstation -> another VM -> Whonix-Gateway)
channel.description:
I would like to conect wm1 to vm2. vm2 will be connected to internet and vm1 will directs its traffic trough vm1.
Any one that have used whonix know what I mean. Whonix workastation is not connected directly but directs it trafic trrough whonix gateway.**
I would like to do the same with two linux vm:s. vm1 would correspond to whonix workstation and vm2 will correspond to gateway.
Its posibel to select a range of networks in virtual box.
**Whonix worksatation conects trough internal network to whonix gateway. As metion I would like to conect** **vm** **1 the same way. Hence I look in** **internal** **network** **but the only option is whonix gateway.**
**Can I some how add** **vm2** **to internal network so it shows up as en option when** **selecting** **interlace** **networks** **for vm1** **?**
**I have bin reading a lot (** **including** **about** **internal networks) with out** **found** **any** **solution** **to this. But It make sens that it** **sould** **be** **possible** **, right?**
**I** **hope this is understandable**. Just to make clear I dont whant to direct the trafic of a vm troug trough whonix gateway.

item.title: a Proxy between Whonix-Workstation and Whonix-Gateway (Whonix-Workstation -> another VM -> Whonix-Gateway)
item.dc:creator: WWW
item.description:
Concerning the ider that whonix connects to what ever "wifi adapter is avalibel ". I think It connects to what ever wifi adapter host is connected to. I have not managed to disconnect host (in Ubuntu). And run a vm on the wifi adapter.

Read full topic

item.title: a Proxy between Whonix-Workstation and Whonix-Gateway (Whonix-Workstation -> another VM -> Whonix-Gateway)
item.dc:creator: WWW
item.description:
Ok, so what is lost when using lets say nested virtualization like this: L0, -L1, -L2, -L3. Or simply setting up an operating system with internal network trough whonix gateway?

And in option one worksation (L2) is included. Will that make a difference compared to directing traffic trough the gateway?

Read full topic

item.title: a Proxy between Whonix-Workstation and Whonix-Gateway (Whonix-Workstation -> another VM -> Whonix-Gateway)
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Security Comparison: Whonix ™-Download-Workstation vs. Whonix-Custom-Workstation ™

WWW:

One of the goal is to run an operating system that is not whonix workstation but that has all the same security features.

Unless you reinvent, re-implement Whonix-Workstation, not possible.

Read full topic
item.source: a Proxy between Whonix-Workstation and Whonix-Gateway (Whonix-Workstation -> another VM -> Whonix-Gateway)

item.title: a Proxy between Whonix-Workstation and Whonix-Gateway (Whonix-Workstation -> another VM -> Whonix-Gateway)
item.dc:creator: WWW
item.description:
Essentially there is 3 main setups that interests me:

  1. The normal set up that comes by default when installing whonix in a vm and using the work station.

  2. running a vm in whonix gateway like this: L0, -L1, -L2, -L3. Discuses earlier.

  3. Simply directing traffic of an other operating system trough whonix gateway. By this I mean: Seating up an internal network; Setting up the proxy settings in the vm that is so to run ist tragic trough whonix gateway. This is basics and very easy to do I hope did not make terminological errors that made this hard to interprete. There a good guide on this with Kali linux on. YouTube called: [How to use Whonix for fully anonymize Kali Linux]

Any way to the point: It would be interesting to know precisely what security features comes with 1(Normal whonix usage). And how these security features are effected in alternative 2 and 3 respectively?

Although It would be interesting I relice that the question abow might require a to elaborate answer.

So most importantly I wounder how 2 and 3 defers from one an other? 2 includes the workstations as the operating system for use runs in side the workstation in a VM .In option 3 the operating system intended for use. Use the gateway excluding the workstation. I would be very interesting to know how this options differ from one an other from a security point of view (if at all ).

In short the most important question is what dose it mean to use an operating system in vm that runs in in whonix workstation(Option 2). Compared to simply directing the traffic trough the whonixgatway independently of workstation (option 3 above).

[quote=“Patrick, post:14, topic:10525”]A yeah. You want to wretch a proxy between. But how do you redirect traffic from the L3 VM through whatever proxy?
[/quote]

One of the goal is to run an operating system that is not whonix workstation but that has all the same security features. Or at least come as close as possible. I don’t fully grasp why option one “wretch a proxy”. Perhaps the answer is in one of links that abow I will read.

Read full topic
item.source: a Proxy between Whonix-Workstation and Whonix-Gateway (Whonix-Workstation -> another VM -> Whonix-Gateway)

item.title: a Proxy between Whonix-Workstation and Whonix-Gateway (Whonix-Workstation -> another VM -> Whonix-Gateway)
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
WWW:

Because whonix, in virtual box, connects to the host wifi adapter be default.

Not exactly. VirtualBox uses whatever host internet connection there is. If LAN cable based, it uses that. If WiFi based, it uses that. If both, it uses both.

In Qubes in theory one might have two NetVMs. One using LAN. Another using WiFi. Yet another, another WiFI USB adapter. Each VM could be configured to use a different NetVM / network device. I haven’t tested this but I don’t see how that would help here.

WWW:

And Qubes seams “simply” to be an operating system consisting of a number of VM:s runing directly on the hardware not in a virtualization software.

Qubes dom0 is at time of writing based on Fedora. It doesn’t have networking by default but that’s irrelevant here. The difference is smaller than you might assume. Simplified: Qubes dom0 is the host. The VMs running inside a virtualizer named Xen.
I.e. Qubes VMs do run inside a virtualizer.

Nested virtualization with Qubes -> see https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Nested_Virtualization#Qubes and please refer to Qubes support since not up to Whonix.

WWW:

So I presume its not reasonable to presume that whonix gateway would behave any differently during this conditions in Qubes than it dose in virtualbox?

Stream isolation and proxy between workstation and gateway is similar as far as this forum thread goes. No important differences.

WWW:

Hench using this setup L0, -L1, -L2, -L3 (disused earlier) is in principle the same and no more secure than ruining Tor in windows?

Using Linux, Whonix either way is better than Windows:

Whonix – 25 Apr 20

Windows Hosts

Windows as Malware, Windows Insecurity, Windows Backdoors and User Freedoms, Windows Sabotage, Windows Interference, Windows Surveillance, Other Windows Abuses, Inescapable Telemetry

When using a Whonix-Workstation routed through a Whonix-Gateway there is a lot less chance of leaks, i.e. connections not going through Tor but using clearnet. At time of writing there have never been any reports of clearnet leaks.

WWW:

L3 runs in whonix workstation with out interfering withe the gateway.

What’s the point? Why not connect a Whonix-Custom-Workstation directly to Whonix-Gateway?
(As per https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Other_Operating_Systems)

A yeah. You want to wretch a proxy between. But how do you redirect traffic from the L3 VM through whatever proxy?

WWW:

Im comfortable with nested virtualization as I see no clear disadvantages (aside from the increased “attack surface”

I think whatever you’re doing it seems like you’re something complicated and unnecessarily complex.

You seem to assume that a VM is a perfect re-implementation of a real computer. It’s not. It’s a more like a bunch of “tricks”. See that chapter https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Nested_Virtualization#Security_Considerations again.

It’s best if the VM is as restricted as possible. If code running in the VM has as little privileges as possible. Hence, there are various initiatives:

Whonix – 4 Oct 20

apparmor-profile-everything

Full System AppArmor Policy

Whonix – 11 May 20

hardened-kernel

hardened-kernel

Whonix – 6 May 20

Multiple Boot Modes for Better Security - an Implementation of Untrusted Root

Persistent User / Live user / Persistent Secureadmin / Persistent Superadmin / Persistent Recovery Mode

Whonix – 6 Nov 20

sandbox-app-launcher - Sandboxed Application Launcher

sandbox-app-launcher is an application launcher that starts each app inside its own restrictive sandbox. It runs each app as its own user, in a bubblewrap sandbox and confined by AppArmor.

Running a virtualizer inside a VM is the opposite of that.

Doing nested virtualization however is something what very few people do. It won’t get half as much attention as Whonix itself. Expecting a VM to run another virtualizer and doing that perfectly without messing up is a real stress test. Virtualization isn’t emulation. I’d suggest to look up both, virtualization and emulation. Compare the both.

I am not sure modern virtualizers are nowadays more secure than pure emulation. (Maybe perhaps not architectural but probably more focus on virtualizer development versus new hardware virtualization features.) Emulation (such as Bochs does) isn’t really viable for Whonix since it’s too slow. Therefore I didn’t look that up. But it makes sense to understand the difference.

Read full topic
item.source: a Proxy between Whonix-Workstation and Whonix-Gateway (Whonix-Workstation -> another VM -> Whonix-Gateway)

item.title: a Proxy between Whonix-Workstation and Whonix-Gateway (Whonix-Workstation -> another VM -> Whonix-Gateway)
item.dc:creator: WWW
item.description:
Thanks for the link that useful.

About connecting Qubes to secondary wifi adapter: Im referring to whonix gateway. I did read somewhere that this was possible (most likely in reddit). But I have not tried it my self . This might be wrong however. And on second thought it probably is.

Because whonix, in virtual box, connects to the host wifi adapter be default. And Qubes seams “simply” to be an operating system consisting of a number of VM:s runing directly on the hardware not in a virtualization software. So I presume its not reasonable to presume that whonix gateway would behave any differently during this conditions in Qubes than it dose in virtualbox?

Any way at this point Im comfortable with nested virtualization as I see no clear disadvantages (aside from the increased “attack surface” (discuses) hence the problem with connecting directly to the wifi adapter independent of host seams to be fixed.

Perhaps more important : After reading some more stream isolation it seams to be what makes whonix what it is (not some secondarily feature) and this is what unable detection of user as “end nod”?

Hench using this setup L0, -L1, -L2, -L3 (disused earlier) is in principle the same and no more secure than ruining Tor in windows?

Read full topic
item.source: a Proxy between Whonix-Workstation and Whonix-Gateway (Whonix-Workstation -> another VM -> Whonix-Gateway)

item.title: a Proxy between Whonix-Workstation and Whonix-Gateway (Whonix-Workstation -> another VM -> Whonix-Gateway)
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
WWW:

Just a shoot in the dark: Will using Qubes solve the problem with of using an other operating system with whonixgatway? I dont know why it would. But how knows…

No.

WWW:

Any way It would be interesting to know if Qubes some how by default fixes the problem with directing the traffic of an other operating system trough whonix?

No.

WWW:

what I do now is that its possible to connect whonix directly to the network adapter in qubes.

Whonix what? Whonix-Gateway or Whonix-Workstation?

WWW:

By the way if using nested virtualization like the setup discuses (L0, -L1, -L2, -L3) must open up for the possibility of using a line of VPN providers as well as different proxis in each individual machine. Probably opening up for a line of unpredictable problems. Jet kind of interesting.

See:

Whonix – 19 Jun 20

Combining Tunnels with Tor

Information on whether Tor gets more or less secure when combining Tor with tunnels such as VPN, SSH, proxies. (User → Tor → proxy/VPN/SSH → Internet) (User → proxy/VPN/SSH → Tor → Internet)

Read full topic
item.source: a Proxy between Whonix-Workstation and Whonix-Gateway (Whonix-Workstation -> another VM -> Whonix-Gateway)

item.title: a Proxy between Whonix-Workstation and Whonix-Gateway (Whonix-Workstation -> another VM -> Whonix-Gateway)
item.dc:creator: WWW
item.description:
Just a shoot in the dark: Will using Qubes solve the problem with of using an other operating system with whonixgatway? I dont know why it would. But how knows…

I suppos this is a whonix qustion.

what I do now is that its possible to connect whonix directly to the network adapter in qubes.

So at least LO, as well as -L1 in the configuration that I would use of I where to run whonix in a VM (L0, -L1, -L2, -L3) will be excluded. That is unrelated to the issues discuses before how ever.

Any way It would be interesting to know if Qubes some how by default fixes the problem with directing the traffic of an other operating system trough whonix?

By the way if using nested virtualization like the setup discuses (L0, -L1, -L2, -L3) must open up for the possibility of using a line of VPN providers as well as different proxis in each individual machine. Probably opening up for a line of unpredictable problems. Jet kind of interesting.

All tough not stream isolation perhaps this will providing very strong security features of this applications (proxy VPN etc) are set up after tor. Perhaps as strong as some of the whonix features.

Any way there supposed to be an isue with tor becous it allows for the possibility of becoming the “end nod” and hence identifiable. Apparently whonix fix this but Is this the same issue as stream isolation? Do sent seam to be the same thing… The former problem (becoming the end node). Seams to be mutch more more serious. Perhaps thats not compromised when running an other operating system trough whonix gateway?

And maby becoming the end nod can be fixt by a succession of VPN and proxy in the VM:s in this setup: L0, -L1, -L2, -L3. Discussed earlier?

Read full topic
item.source: a Proxy between Whonix-Workstation and Whonix-Gateway (Whonix-Workstation -> another VM -> Whonix-Gateway)

item.title: a Proxy between Whonix-Workstation and Whonix-Gateway (Whonix-Workstation -> another VM -> Whonix-Gateway)
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
WWW:

And in order to solve this this proxification for those application are suggested.

It doesn’t use the term proxification. It says using a proxifier. Not the same thing.

WWW:

If I got it right user is advised use different proxies for eatch application

Usual proxy won’t help. See:

Whonix – 19 Jun 20

Combining Tunnels with Tor

Information on whether Tor gets more or less secure when combining Tor with tunnels such as VPN, SSH, proxies. (User → Tor → proxy/VPN/SSH → Internet) (User → proxy/VPN/SSH → Tor → Internet)

Whonix – 26 Jul 20

Connecting to Tor before a Proxy

Instructions on how to connect to Tor before a proxy (User → Tor → Proxy → Internet)

It’s only stream isolated when different applications are pointed to different Tor SocksPorts (or HttpPorts).

WWW:

Conclusively what if user would proxify the entire vm that runs in L2 (whonix workstation) in configuration I decribe abow? Would that fix the problem with broken streamisolation?

No, if a whole VM is routed through Tor as one, then it’s actually not stream isolated. Once you wretch something between the application (running in workstation) and Tor (running on gateway), it can no longer be stream isolated.

Read full topic
item.source: a Proxy between Whonix-Workstation and Whonix-Gateway (Whonix-Workstation -> another VM -> Whonix-Gateway)

item.title: a Proxy between Whonix-Workstation and Whonix-Gateway (Whonix-Workstation -> another VM -> Whonix-Gateway)
item.dc:creator: WWW
item.description:
The solution with nested virtualization seams to solve and or make many of the issues so far easier.

Concerning streamisolation I have to read more in order to relay grasp this. But I did find a text in whonix respiratory on streamisolation. It discuses how some applications will not by default be taken in by the general stream isolation provided in whionix workstation. And in order to solve this this proxification for those application are suggested.

If I got it right user is advised use different proxies for eatch application in order to avoid the detection of a common source. Hence reconstructing stream isolation,

I relation to to the problems I accounted in the setup I describe above (Runing a operating system in a vm in whonixworksation). I figure that it in principle is that same problem: Just as whonix cant proxify some application it cant by the same principle proxify other operating systems.

Conclusively what if user would proxify the entire vm that runs in L2 (whonix workstation) in configuration I decribe abow? Would that fix the problem with broken streamisolation?

Read full topic
item.source: a Proxy between Whonix-Workstation and Whonix-Gateway (Whonix-Workstation -> another VM -> Whonix-Gateway)

item.title: a Proxy between Whonix-Workstation and Whonix-Gateway (Whonix-Workstation -> another VM -> Whonix-Gateway)
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Did you see this page yet?

Whonix – 3 Oct 20

Nested Virtualization - Whonix

It is possible to run Virtual Machines (VMs) inside other VMs. That is called Nested Virtualization.

WWW:

What about nested virtualization? Will that also break stream isolation of Whonix-Workstation?

If a VM runs inside Whonix-Workstation it won’t be stream isolated unless that VM is manually configured to. This article mostly still applies:

Whonix – 26 Sep 20

Other Operating Systems - Whonix

Anonymize any Operating System! Your operating system tunneled through the Tor Anonymity Network! Create your Whonix-Custom-Workstation ™!

Read full topic
item.source: a Proxy between Whonix-Workstation and Whonix-Gateway (Whonix-Workstation -> another VM -> Whonix-Gateway)

item.title: a Proxy between Whonix-Workstation and Whonix-Gateway (Whonix-Workstation -> another VM -> Whonix-Gateway)
item.dc:creator: WWW
item.description:
Patrick:

If you manage to succeed with both experiments you should be able to pull it all together. This however as I said is not easy, and undocumented.

Thanks for braking it up as well as presenting reading on each step. So far I read the fist link you posted. And can see (on some level) why its not advisable to use gateway with out workstation.

What about nested virtualization? Will that also break stream isolation of Whonix-Workstation? I soposse not becous workstation is used in this configuration and the link withe gateway sould be intact. I ask because this an other option that will might achieve the same end.

For clarity the setup would look like this (using the general terminology ):

L0, -L1, -L2, -L3

L0 is host, L1 is the first operating system ruining in the first virtual box. L2 is whonix workstation that runs on a VM that runs in L1 (of coures gateway also runs in L1), and final L3 (that runs in a VM that runs in L3) is the operating system I intend to use. The lines represent a vm ruing inside the presiding operating system (left to right). By the way L1 connects directly to to the wifi adapter.

I figure this would actually work?

Essentially runing L2 (whonix workstation and gateway) in a virtual box that runs in L1. sould not be different from ruining whionix on a vm that runs in host. L3 runs in whonix workstation with out interfering withe the gateway. I cant see why the integrity of whinix workstation and whinix gateway woud be compromised in this configuration.

Would this approach work?

I guse this deviate from the topic but figured it might be unnecessary to set up a new thread. And besides it would not contain the back ground.

Read full topic
item.source: a Proxy between Whonix-Workstation and Whonix-Gateway (Whonix-Workstation -> another VM -> Whonix-Gateway)

item.title: a Proxy between Whonix-Workstation and Whonix-Gateway (Whonix-Workstation -> another VM -> Whonix-Gateway)
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
No, not easy.

It would break stream isolation of Whonix-Workstation. What is stream isolation? See:

Whonix – 26 Oct 20

Stream Isolation: Easy

Whonix ™ Tor Stream Isolation Short Introduction

Therefore you’d have to disable stream isolation. See:

Whonix – 19 Jun 20

Disable Stream Isolation: Easy

How to disable stream isolation. Easiest and most common methods only.

1) VM1 would need to be connected to an internal network with VM2.

2) And VM2 connected with an internal network to VM3.

As for 2) I suggest an easier exercise first: Set up a Whonix-Custom-Workstation with another operating system (such as Debian buster). For that, you can follow this documentation:

Whonix – 26 Sep 20

Other Operating Systems - Whonix

Anonymize any Operating System! Your operating system tunneled through the Tor Anonymity Network! Create your Whonix-Custom-Workstation ™!

Once you’ve mastered that exercise, try the next exercise.

As for 1) I recommend the following exercise. Set up two VMs, VM A and VM B. VM A is connected through an internal network with VM B. Probably good to use Debian stable (currently: buster) in both cases Then configure VM B to do IP forwarding. I.e. learn how VM B can do IP forwarding for VM A. In other words, how to allow VM A to connect through VM B.

VM A -> VM B -> Internet

You might not find VM specific documentation. Doing such as setup with physically separate computers, for example two separate notebooks would be a good exercise. Notebook A connected to notebook B only. Then notebook B doing IP forwarding for notebook A.

IP forwarding is off-topic in Whonix forums for now as we don’t have this documented. It’s unspecific to Whonix.

(Whonix-Gateway has IP forwarding disabled. It’s design is different, see https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Dev/Whonix_Networking if you want, but that doesn’t matter in your case.)

If you manage to succeed with both experiments you should be able to pull it all together. This however as I said is not easy, and undocumented.

Whonix – 19 Jun 20

Undocumented / Untested / Unsupported

This feature is either undocumented, untested, or unsupported. Options: Become Contributor / Apply Free Support Principle / Purchase Professional Support.

Read full topic
item.source: a Proxy between Whonix-Workstation and Whonix-Gateway (Whonix-Workstation -> another VM -> Whonix-Gateway)

item.title: a Proxy between Whonix-Workstation and Whonix-Gateway (Whonix-Workstation -> another VM -> Whonix-Gateway)
item.dc:creator: WWW
item.description:
1m

The end goal is to use whonix gateway between the two vm:s I describe above. I could have included that aspect in the question right away. How ever if figured that might be to hard grasp.

Any way this is what the end goal would look like:

vm1 -> vm2 - >vm3 - > network adapter

In this configuration I would use vm1 as an operating system, vm2 is whonix gateway and finally vm3 connects to network adapter.

Connecting a vm of any sort to whonix gateway is possible trough “internal network” (an option in virtualbox). But can whonix gateway connect to an other wm trough an internal network. ?

Thats the question I wounder if any one has en answer to? It seams to me that it must be a very basic binary answer. /Best regards

Read full topic
item.source: a Proxy between Whonix-Workstation and Whonix-Gateway (Whonix-Workstation -> another VM -> Whonix-Gateway)

item.title: a Proxy between Whonix-Workstation and Whonix-Gateway (Whonix-Workstation -> another VM -> Whonix-Gateway)
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
WWW:

Just to make clear I dont whant to direct the trafic of a vm troug trough whonix gateway.

If the question isn’t about Whonix, it should be asked elsewhere, as per:

Whonix – 26 Oct 20

Support - Whonix

Various Ways to get Help with Whonix ™. Free and Professional Support available.

Btw I also advice reading this page:

Whonix – 26 Oct 20

Surfing Posting Blogging - Whonix

Surf, Blog and Post anonymously on the Internet. Essential knowledge about Anonymous File Sharing, Keystroke / Mouse Fingerprinting and Stylometry risks. Tips for avoiding detection.

As the typos you’re making probably make for a unique typing style, i.e. that page suggests to use a spell checker among other things.

Read full topic
item.source: a Proxy between Whonix-Workstation and Whonix-Gateway (Whonix-Workstation -> another VM -> Whonix-Gateway)

item.title: a Proxy between Whonix-Workstation and Whonix-Gateway (Whonix-Workstation -> another VM -> Whonix-Gateway)
item.dc:creator: WWW
item.description:
I would like to conect wm1 to vm2. vm2 will be connected to internet and vm1 will directs its traffic trough vm1.

Any one that have used whonix know what I mean. Whonix workastation is not connected directly but directs it trafic trrough whonix gateway.**

I would like to do the same with two linux vm:s. vm1 would correspond to whonix workstation and vm2 will correspond to gateway.

Its posibel to select a range of networks in virtual box.

Whonix worksatation conects trough internal network to whonix gateway. As metion I would like to conect vm 1 the same way. Hence I look in internal network but the only option is whonix gateway.

Can I some how add vm2 to internal network so it shows up as en option when selecting interlace networks for vm1 ?

I have bin reading a lot ( including about internal networks) with out found any solution to this. But It make sens that it sould be possible , right?

I hope this is understandable. Just to make clear I dont whant to direct the trafic of a vm troug trough whonix gateway.

Read full topic
item.source: a Proxy between Whonix-Workstation and Whonix-Gateway (Whonix-Workstation -> another VM -> Whonix-Gateway)
